description: Sven Halek, after careful deliberation and reviewing reports of public unrest, makes a covert decision to amplify the vanished citizens’ distributed messages instead of calling for a Council-led tribunal. He authorizes a small group of trusted tech contacts to boost access to the mysterious network appearing in data coins, setting the stage for the next phase of the crisis.

New waves of data coins appear in dense neighborhoods, now containing evolving personal messages and practical guidance attributed to the vanished. Citizens become active in deciphering and following these messages, spreading civil aid across previously locked-down city districts. Excitement grows, but loyalty splits form between those following the vanished and those upholding the Council and BCI.

Council technical teams trace the data coin activity to a dormant peer-to-peer network embedded in the BCI by Marek Halden in 2023. The network circumvents Council control, allowing vanished citizens to communicate securely with the public. Council leaders debate urgent responses but remain divided.

City life is transformed as rival networks emerge: pro-vanished groups coordinate grassroots resource distribution and self-organization, while BCI loyalists attempt to restore algorithmic order through public messaging and neighborhood rallies.

Facing growing instability, the Council meets in crisis session. Some members press for shutting down local networks, while others urge dialogue with representatives of the vanished. Sven monitors both sides, his strategy shaping the public’s rapidly changing allegiances.
